Crimes.Violation_Type: Use of false documents to enter Canada
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether applicants can demonstrate serious issues to be tried, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience for a stay of removal
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants entered Canada with false documents; refugee claims were rejected; claimed new risks due to age and country conditions in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending judicial review of PRRA decision
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Applicants failed to meet the three-part test for a stay: serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Entry using false documents, failure to establish credible basis for risk on return
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged risk of harm upon return to Sri Lanka based on age and general country conditions
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Three-part test for stay: serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility and specificity of risk claims
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Motion for stay of removal pending judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Used: PRRA assessment, country condition reports, applicants' submissions
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections related to PRRA and admissibility under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Basis: Perceived risk due to age and generalized conditions in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Lack of specific evidence linking applicants to individualized risk
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Test for granting a stay in immigration cases
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of irreparable harm or personal risk
Crimes.Outcome: Stay denied; removal order to proceed
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No credible evidence of irreparable harm upon return
Crimes.Cause_Description: Refusal of refugee status and PRRA due to lack of credible risk evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed submitted evidence and found it inadequate
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on misrepresentation and admissibility
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Vague, speculative, and unsupported by concrete details
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Applicants not in compliance due to inadmissibility
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Use of false documents at entry
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal jurisdiction over immigration and refugee matters
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Risk claims not substantiated with individualized evidence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No serious issue to be tried; public interest in enforcing immigration laws
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Generalized fears without personal nexus to risk
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience

Crimes.Crime_Name: Making False Statements under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether applicants face irreparable harm if removed to Sri Lanka
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Motion for stay pending judicial review of PRRA decision
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Affidavits, country condition reports, PRRA decision
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of forced recruitment by LTTE due to age and family history
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Three-part test for stay: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible, specific evidence of personal risk
Crimes.Decision_Maker: PRRA Officer and Federal Court judge
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Sections of IRPA relating to risk assessment and misrepresentation
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to provide individualized risk evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None; court found evidence insufficient rather than ignored
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Application_Factor: Age, family ties, alleged LTTE recruitment practices
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Stay dismissed; removal allowed to proceed
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of PRRA officer's risk assessment
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA sections on protected persons and risk assessment
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence of personal risk upon return
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 115, s. 129, and related regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: PRRA process found to be fair and thorough
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not primary focus; centered on truthfulness of statements
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicants’ assertions lacked detail and supporting evidence
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of PRRA decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and adequacy of motion for stay
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose or prove individualized risk factors
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation and security concerns (alleged LTTE links)

Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Inadmissibility due to misrepresentation and risk upon removal
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Eligibility for stay of removal based on claimed risk in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Motion for stay pending judicial review of PRRA refusal
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims considered vague and lacking personal nexus
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Affidavits, country reports, PRRA decision record
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of harm due to forced recruitment by LTTE and age-related vulnerability
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Absence of specific, credible evidence of risk
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPA provisions on misrepresentation and protected person status
Crimes.Application_Error: Overreliance on generalized country conditions without personal risk indicators
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to PRRA findings
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: No indication that relevant evidence was ignored
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Application_Factor: Emotional harm to family cited but not recognized as irreparable harm
Crimes.Authority: Canada Border Services Agency / Minister of IRCC
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether PRRA decision was reasonable and legally sound
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 40(1) – Misrepresentation; s. 97 – Risk assessment
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Judicial review unlikely to succeed; no stay granted
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Prior misrepresentation, failed refugee claim, lack of credible risk evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections on misrepresentation and removal orders
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroborative or individualized evidence
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Related through use of false documents at entry
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Assertions not supported by specific facts or documentation
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that new evidence warranted reconsideration
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Federal immigration and refugee law in Canada
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Request for interim relief during appeal process
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to establish personal risk despite new submissions
